page.title: 19SOCIAL CLUBS
page.content: Didcot Labour Club has 450 members who pay 1.26p when they first join, then 1.00p each year. It opens at 11 am except on Wednesday and again at 7 pm. There is a bar, a billiards table and a ballroom, which is upstairs. This can be hired by members who want to hold a private function. A kitchen may also be hired. The Duke of Marlborough's grandfather opened the Marlborough Club about 50 years ago. Both the old and very expensive snooker tables came with the building. Most of the 400 members, who own the Club, are local. The Club is open seven days a week. It also has a Theatre Club and, like the Labour Club, its rooms may be hired for special purposes, such as weddings and lectures. There used to be a tennis court, but it no longer exists.
